thread.title: Bobcats sail past Buccaneers in 63-7 win
thread.title_full: Bobcats sail past Buccaneers in 63-7 win

title: Bobcats sail past Buccaneers in 63-7 win
text:
Griz beat UND 42-16 
MSU scored touchdowns on their first five possessions in the first half, and on their first two possessions after the break to build a commanding 49-0 lead. 
Running back Chad Newell had three total touchdowns in the first half, with two on the ground and one by way of an eight-yard reception. The junior finished the day with 42 yards on the ground on ten carries. 
Quarterback Dakota Prukop was 15-of-21 through the air, throwing for 226 yards and three touchdowns. The junior also picked up 31 yards rushing on just four carries. 
Senior wide receiver Mitch Griebel had a team-high five receptions for 62 yards, while sophomore Justin Paige led the way with 92 receiving yards on just two catches, including a 41-yard touchdown reception in the first quarter. 
After its worst performance of the season, the Montana State defense played exceptionally well, allowing a season-low seven points. The Bobcats forced four Buccaneer turnovers, equaling the turnover total through the first six games of the season. 
Special teams was also a critical factor in the game. Sophomore running back Nick LaSane blocked a punt that set up Montana State's second touchdown, and sophomore wide receiver Jayshawn Gates had a 97-yard kickoff return touchdown late in the fourth quarter that helped produce the final margin of victory. 
The Bobcats improve to 4-3 on the season, and they return to Big Sky Conference play next week as they hit the road to play North Dakota in Grand Forks.
